New_Orleans.Florida Canal:
The Florida Canal or 40 Arpent Canal is a canal in the New Orleans metropolitan area and land down river.

The canal was built in the 18th century colonial era of Louisiana, stretching from what is now the Faubourg Marigny neighborhood of New Orleans, roughly paralleling the Mississippi River on the East Bank down through modern Saint Bernard Parish and part of the East Bank of Plaquemines. Colonial land grants commonly stretched 40 arpents back from the Mississippi River.
